docs.snippet: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Nov. 6 -- An eight-year Soviet boycott will end when Russian delegates take their places next week at the eighth general conference of the United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization.

docs.snippet: Foreign exchanges did very little in the way of rate variations or volume business last week. British sterling came higher from London on Monday, on the settlement of the dock strike, but the advantage soon disappeared in the absence of a sustained...
docs.lead_paragraph: Foreign exchanges did very little in the way of rate variations or volume business last week. British sterling came higher from London on Monday, on the settlement of the dock strike, but the advantage soon disappeared in the absence of a sustained demand.

docs.snippet: The foreign exchange market passed through a listless trading week. While there was a good volume of business it produced nothing in the way of sizable price changes, except in the case of British sterling.
